title: Blue Jays reach 1M Twitter followers
text:
Based on what we've seen, Jays letdown seems inevitable 
The Blue Jays bandwagon apparently has wings. 
As the team prepared for the American League Division Series, the Jays reached the 1-million-follower mark on Twitter on Wednesday. 
The team has long embraced it’s fans on Twitter, but the @BlueJays official account soared this season, gaining more than more than 350,000 followers, Twitter Canada’s director of media Christopher Doyle said. 
He credited three main factors for the team’s single-season record-high jump in followers. 
“Their performance on the field, their use of Twitter to engage fans in stadium and the fact that so many of the players are very active on Twitter: (Marcus) Stroman , David Price , (Jose) Bautista , Edwin (Encarnacion) , (Chris) Colabello , (Kevin) Pillar . The list goes on,” he said. 
Fans flock to Twitter because it makes it easy to connect with players, Doyle said. 
“Stroman and Price are two of the best athletes on Twitter. They connect with fans in an authentic way,” Doyle said. “Stroman documented his entire recovery from injury on Twitter. It was very personal and he shared it with fans.” 
Twitter Canada, meanwhile, has embraced Blue Jays mania. During the Jays’ post-season run, if you tweet the season motto #ComeTogether, a red maple leaf emoji will appear. Sponsored Links
